thread.title: Danbury Railway Museum’s Pumpkin Patch Train running on weekends
thread.title_full: Danbury Railway Museum’s Pumpkin Patch Train running on weekends

title: Danbury Railway Museum’s Pumpkin Patch Train running on weekends
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 
Take a short ride on a vintage train to the Danbury Railway Museum’s pumpkin patch Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 10 and 11. Photo: Contributed Photo Take a short ride on a vintage train to the Danbury Railway... Danbury Railway Museum’s Pumpkin Patch Train running on weekends 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Welcome the cooler weather this weekend with a short ride on a vintage train at the Danbury Railway Museum ’s pumpkin patch. 
This popular family event takes place Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 10 and 11, and continues weekends through Sunday, Oct. 25. 
A 1920s passenger coach takes visitors through the historic rail yard to the pumpkin field, where each child receives a free pumpkin. You also can stop in at the restored train station, which is more than 100 years old, to see exhibits, artifacts and multiple operating model train layouts. 
Kids can enjoy free activities such as the coloring station, temporary tattoos, cider and cookies. There’s a gift shop, too. No reservations are required. The event is held rain or shine, and children are encouraged to come in costume. 
Trains depart hourly beginning a half hour after opening; the last train leaves at 3:30 p.m. 
Danbury Railway Museum, 120 White St. Saturdays and Sundays, Oct. 10, 11, 17, 18, 24 and 25. Saturdays, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sundays, noon-4 p.m. $10 ages 2 and over; free for children under 24 months. 203-778-8337, danburyrail.org
